alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued August 21 at 10:02AM PDT until August 21 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MCKINNEY BURN SCAR IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the McKinney burn scar. * WHERE...Areas around and within the McKinney burn scar. This includes sections of highway 96 adjacent to the burn scar. Vesa Creek and Humbug Creek are at highest risk of mud slides or debris flows. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...There is potential for heavy rainfall over the McKinney burn scar during the period of the watch. People traveling on Highway 96, living along Klamath River Road or recreating in the Humbug area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The potential for rainfall rates exceeding 0.5 inches an hour - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
